actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Government Operations.

official_title: Resolution directing the Administrator of the General Services Administration to furnish information concerning the expenditure of Federal funds for administrative support and personnel at or near private residences of certain Presidents of the United States.

summary.text: Directs the Administrator of the General Services Administration, to the extent possible, to furnish to the House of Representatives, not later than fifteen days following the adoption of this resolution, all documents with respect to the expenditure of Federal moneys for administrative support and personnel at either Government-owned or privately owned properties located near a private residence of: (1) Franklin D. Roosevelt; (2) Harry S. Truman; (3) Dwight D. Eisenhower; (4) John F. Kennedy; and (5) Lyndon B. Johnson, during the period in which they were entitled to protection and support by the Federal Government as a result of being President or Vice President of the United States of America.

titles.title: Resolution directing the Administrator of the General Services Administration to furnish information concerning the expenditure of Federal funds for administrative support and personnel at or near private residences of certain Presidents of the United States.
